sub_title: Circular Economy | Strategy | Data-Driven Transition | System Innovation
summary:
Thanks for your visit!

I am very happy with my choice for the bachelor study in Liberal Arts and Sciences. That study taught me to think critically about challenging problems from different angles in order to arrive at holistic solutions.

By analyzing I like to create an overview to know why I do something and what is the most strategic and efficient way to achieve my goals.

I keep a close eye on innovations and new developments and I look very practically at how I can implement these in my own work to optimize processes within the company or my own actions.
I am very result-oriented, so by creating an overview, integrating new developments, and analyzing processes, I can achieve good results with targeted strategies.

An example of this is the efficient turnover growth of uitgetypt.nl of more than 40% under my leadership, while at the same time reducing overhead hours by 50%. Uitgetypt.nl was rewarded in 2018 with the FD Gazelle label (Dutch recognition for growth).

As a person, I am very curious and I like to learn something new every week. With the new skills and knowledge, I hope to have a positive impact on the people around me, society, or nature. I also like to connect different people and ideas, the creativity that comes with it gives me a lot of energy. A nice interplay between inspiring and being inspired.

I always enjoy meeting new people and exchanging thoughts. If you are interested in a (virtual) cup of coffee, please send me a message at matthijsbookelmann@routecirculair.nl

Interests: Biomimicry, creativity, innovation & innovation processes, minimalism, doughnut economics, social entrepreneurship, circular economy, nature, ecosystems, resilience, data-driven decision-making, and strategy.

Experience with: entrepreneurship, innovation, data-driven decision-making, SMEs, customer development, operations management, strategy, workshops.

projects.title: Interreg North Sea Region 'Futures by Design'
projects.description:
Futures by Design (FBD) aims to enable less prosperous SMEs in regions of lower economic success, to innovate, grow or increase productivity. SMEs are critical to regional economies but their capacity for success can be limited by insufficient access to data and the inability to analyse data to drive innovation and improved results. FBD aims to strengthen those SMEs and foster innovativeness in the partner regions.

FBD will work with SMEs in partner regions in the Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, Sweden and the United Kingdom, sharing knowledge, ideas and regional experiences to support SMEs to become more data-driven and better informed about the economic, technological, policy and supply changes that will shape their futures. FBD will create a virtual transnational horizon-scanning and knowledge transfer (HSKT) hub connecting 6 hubs in the partner regions to support sustainable SME growth, innovation and productivity.

contributors.headline: Circular Economy | Strategy | Data-Driven Transition | System Innovation

projects.title: Fujifilm Future Challenge
projects.description: The so called ‘Fujifilm Future Challenge’ is an initiative from Fujifilm and several educational institutions in The Netherlands (Avans Academy for applied science, Technical University Eindhoven and the University of Tilburg). Different teams of students work on new business models based on technologies of the multinational corporation. As participating students we will have access to Fujifilm’s technological expertise through the recently established ‘Fuijfilm Open Innovation Hub Europe’ and follow additional masterclasses/workshops next to the mentoring that we will receive form an academic coach.

company.name: Jheronimus Academy of Data Science (Tilburg University & Eindhoven University of Technology)

profile_positions.description:
The JADS MKB Datalab provides SMEs with access to Data Science and offers students from the Jheronimus Academy of Data Science the opportunity to gain relevant work experience. Between early 2018 and October 2023, our +/- 80 involved Master Data Science students have assisted > 160 entrepreneurs in >300 projects. 

I was involved in optimizing our operational processes, refining our proposition and service, business development, setting up collaborations within the ecosystem, facilitating our 'Data-Driven Business workshop', giving inspiration sessions, and expanding the concept to 6 other university cities.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead Impact | JADS MKB Datalab

profile_positions.description:
As JADS we develop tools for SMEs to make more Data-Driven Decisions, these tools are used by the partners of 'Futures by Design' in The Netherlands, The United Kingdom, Belgium, Germany, and Sweden.

I represent JADS at international conferences where together with the other partners of the project 'Futures by Design' we define which tools should be developed. Together with the JADS SME Datalab team, I develop de tools that will be used by SMEs in the countries above.
profile_positions.title: Representative JADS - Interreg North Sea Region 'Futures by Design'

profile_positions.description:
In the Master course "Data Entrepreneurship in Action III" students work in teams on the development of their own innovative start-up. During the 16 weeks of the course they go roughly through 5 stages: 

1) Problem Definition 2) Problem validation 3) Solution Formulation 4) Solution Validation 5) Final Pitch. 

During the course, I have graded presentations, mentored student teams in the development of their innovative start-up ideas, and organized mentor sessions with external mentors.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Staff Data Entrepreneurship in Action III

profile_positions.description:
At the Jheronimus Academy of Data Science (JADS) we aim to help students explore their entrepreneurial career as an entrepreneur or corporate entrepreneur.

I have explored the possibilities of a university incubator for JADS and co-wrote the plan for the extracurricular program called 'JADS Playground', which aims at guiding students in their entrepreneurial journey outside the curriculum.
profile_positions.title: JADS Playground - Data Entrepreneurship

profile_positions.description:
As Entrepreneurship Trainee, I followed a 1,5-year program in which I gained experience in three different companies which were all in a different phase of their growth (mature enterprise, scale-up, and startup). I received training and mentorship during the whole program to develop myself in the field of entrepreneurship.

- For the first 9 months, I ran a Uitgetypt.nl in the Benelux. 
- For the following 6 months, I have explored the international expansion of Markeninja a Brazilian Online Marketing company in the Netherlands. 
- For the last 9 months:
1) I started my own company, an automated transcription an analysis tool for customer service data;
2) I was one of three people leading the fast scaling JADS MKB Datalab project; and
3) I laid the foundation for the JADS Playground an extracurricular program to guide students on their entrepreneurial journey outside of the curriculum.

Trainings I followed:
- Platform (Two-sided market) economics
- Online Marketing (Google)
- Growth Hacking
- WordPress Basics
- Foundations of Sales and Acquisition
profile_positions.title: Trainee Entrepreneurship

profile_positions.description:
Markeninja is an Online Marketing agency operating in Rio de Janeiro and São Paolo in Brazil, that offers services ranging from WordPress web development, content creation, online marketing campaigns, technical SEO to link building.

-I traveled to Brazil to learn the basics of Markeninja’s business practices and to get acquainted with Markeninja’s business processes. 
-I have conducted market research for the Dutch Market to identify business opportunities and scope out industry competition, thereby developing, analyzing, and adjusting the business plan.  
-I have led the pilots with initial pilot clients to test the product-market fit of Markeninja’s offerings for the Dutch Market.
profile_positions.title: International Expansion Manager a.i. (via Entrepreneurship Traineeship)

profile_positions.description:
Uitgetypt is a multinational transcription agency that converts audio recordings into text documents which are usually used for documentation, research, or storage. 

Responsibilities:
- I managed daily business operations, leading the general management team and a total of 120 transcribers. 
- I improved the operational processes, standardized our offerings, and made the company more resilient by turning the decision making processes into a digital and more automated process. 
- I formulated short- and long-term strategies to keep growing while maintaining the quality of our service high. An important factor was the focus on upskilling our workforce and improving the recruitment and training processes to increase the capacity of our workforce both with our already existing workforce and as well as with newly acquired workforce.  
- I improved communication within the organization to be able to better deal with the growth challenges that resulted from the transformation of the business processes.
- I collaborated with IT to improve the robustness of infrastructure as well as the tracking and analysis of performance metrics and other organizational insights to boost data-driven decision-making.

Accomplishments:
* over 40% increase in revenue during my time as Benelux Manager.
* Decrease of 50% of the operational overhead time on core business process.
* FD Gazelle label 2018 & 2019
profile_positions.title: Benelux Manager | COO a.i. (via Enterpreneurship Traineeship)

profile_positions.description:
Part-time board member of the outgoing Global Community Development Program (oGCDP) team of AIESEC Tilburg (app. 20h/week). 
The oGCDP team of AIESEC Tilburg aims at sending students to projects all over the world in order to fulfill their potential and have a positive impact on society. 

Main responsibilities: 
- External Relations at Eindhoven University of Technology
- Marketing plan, creation of brand awareness and raising students for AIESEC's programs
- Preparing, guiding and coaching students who go abroad
profile_positions.title: External Relations and Partnerships Manager, Eindhoven Manager

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the Network of Climate Coaches

volunteer_experiences.description:
A unique business case competition where Dutch and Ghanaian students work together in teams in order to solve a complex business problem. The New Business Challenge is all about discovering new sustainable business opportunities for Dutch companies in Ghana and promoting trade between both countries.
During the project, I worked on the People's Pension Trust business case, which aimed to increase the number of individual clients and simultaneously transform the payment method from cash to mobile. The project took place partly in The Hague, The Netherlands and partly in Accra, Ghana.
Improving the living situation of the Andean indians, by collecting clothes and money for eductional material and personally delivering this at a school in Patacancha, Peru.

Protection of biodiversity and eduction about nature in Peru, e.g. the Amazon rainforest. Fundraising with a variety of local activities in the Netherlands before personally delivering the gathered money in Peru.
Together with 7 other high school students, I ran a company selling watches for a year as part of the high school course Management & Organization. The total profit of >€2000 was donated to KiKa.
